title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message:
820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
- BKLT_EN_L - 0V
- BKLT_EN_DIV - 12.2v
- F9700 is fine and has 12.6V on both sides
- PPBUS_SW_BKLT - 0v
- BKLT_EN - 0v
- 5V_S0  not present
- D9701 Pin 1:  0v
- D9701 Pin 2:  0v
- Pin 1 of LCD connector has  0v
- R9753 and R9757 are both good and have continuity to U9701
- BKL_SW -  0v
- BKL_FB -  0v

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message: That seems very unlikely. Did you measure those with an LCD connected?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message: with LCD connected [LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px]LCD_BKLT_EN is [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][SIZE=14px][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial]0V[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][/SIZE][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px] and BKLT_PLT_RST_L is  [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][SIZE=14px][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial]3V.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][/SIZE]

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message: The display is tested working? Do you have other display to test???

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message:
with LCD connected 
LCD_BKLT_EN is 
0V
and BKLT_PLT_RST_L is 
3V.

PLT_RST has always been high, there is no way for the board to boot without that being present. That means your measurements were not correct.

Are you 100% sure there is video on the LCD? Check if SMC_LID is high.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A No back light, Video yes.
message: my display has liquid damage , power cable burn , jump the wire and now working. Thanks for helping.
